name: SupportFranzAndAmelia
_source: speak;Franz;Oh, hello there.|You're...|Ah, it's Amelia, isn't it?
speak;Franz;That's right.|How are you?|Getting the hang of things?
speak;Amelia;Oh, yes.|Quite!|You know, everyone here is so much friendlier than the folks in Grado.|I'm glad there are so many people around my age traveling with us.
speak;Franz;Yeah.|I think I'm about the same age as you are, too.|You know what that means?|That means, from now on, you're my rival.
speak;Amelia;Um...|Well, does that mean...|I have to fight you?

speak;Franz;No, no.|It's nothing as complicated as all that.|We'll just work together.|See, I'll try to be better than you, and you try to be better than me!|Every day, try to be a better person than you are today.|It's easier to do when you've got someone to work with.

speak;Franz;Yes, well.|Um...|My brother's a knight, too, and he's had someone like that for a long time.|I've always been envious of the competitive relationship he has.|They compete, and they argue, and they bicker...|But I know they respect one another, and they grow together.|I envy that.
speak;Amelia;Um...|I'm not sure I can be like that.
speak;Franz;Ha ha ha...|Don't worry about it.|It doesn't matter who you are.|All that really matters is that we have someone like that in our lives.|Besides, you are a qualified soldier, are you not?
speak;Amelia;Er...|I'm not honestly sure I'm even qualified to be out here.
speak;Franz;Same here.|That's why I picked you.|Let's work together.
speak;Amelia;All right!|I'm not sure I can live up to your expectations...|But I'll do my best.
speak;Franz;Good.|It's nice to meet you, Amelia.
speak;Franz;We are rivals, right?|There's no need for the formality of titles.
speak;Franz;Ha ha ha...|You did it again.
speak;Amelia;Ha ha...|I'm not used to being so casual.
speak;Franz;Can I ask you, what do you think of this war?

speak;Franz;I still don't understand why Grado chose to invade Renais.|Grado and Renais were allies.|Their royal families were close friends.|Why, Prince Ephraim and Princess Eirika are friends with your Prince Lyon.|I detect something funny here.|I simply cannot believe a friendship so strong could end so abruptly.|How many lives have been destroyed by such a seemingly random turn of events?|Perhaps the prince and princess know more of the truth, but...
speak;Franz;Oh, I'm sorry.|I don't mean to besmirch your homeland's name.

speak;Amelia;No, it's all right.|I wonder what drives Grado's ambitions now, too.|I was born in a rural village and raised in Grado's countryside.|Ever since I was a little child, I took pride in my home's origins.|Grado, of course, is named after the legendary hero who saved all of Magvel.|I thought I lived in a country that believed in justice and peace.|But this war...|It's something different than all that.
speak;Franz;Amelia...|I'm sorry.|This war must be especially painful for you...

speak;Amelia;I'll be fine, Franz. But thank you, though.|It was wrong of Grado to invade Renais.|Nothing can justify it.|Grado has no right to destroy whole nations, ruin people's lives.|This is all so...so wrong!|I began this war as a soldier in Grado's armies.|But now...|I just want to believe...|I want to believe in justice!|I want to know I'm doing the right thing!

speak;Franz;Amelia...|I understand it all very well.|Your love of your homeland...|Your sense of justice, of honor...|If there's anything I can do to help you, please let me know.|We are rivals, but that doesn't mean we can't also be friends, right?
speak;Franz;Why did you become a soldier?
speak;Amelia;When I was little, I lived in a remote village with my mother.|One day...bandits raided our village and took my mother.
speak;Amelia;I had no father...|My mother was my only family.|She was so sick...|and so very weak...
speak;Amelia;When the bandits came...|I hid under the bed...
speak;Amelia;I wanted to protect her!|I...wanted to be strong!|Even if I couldn't win...|I wanted to fight!|To protect the only person dear to me...
speak;Franz;I see now...|Thank you for telling me your story.|I want you to know this, Amelia.|...My parents are gone, too.

speak;Franz;Yes...|Well, I do have a brother, though.|But I don't remember my mother.|But I swore that I would live my every moment to its fullest.|I swore to my parents that I would live a long life for them and be happy.|Amelia...|You're living the same way, embracing each passing moment.|You believe in yourself, and your faith burns in you, making you shine.|I don't know what it is you plan to do with your life, but as long as we travel the same path, would you let me walk beside you?|I have my own path to follow, I know, but...|I believe we're both walking toward the same goal.
speak;Amelia;Franz...|Thank you...|I'm really happy.|But...I want to protect you, too.|I am a soldier of sorts as well, you know.|So...let me be your shield to protect you...
speak;Franz;And I will be your sword and fight for you.|From now on.|You're not alone anymore, Amelia.
